name: J.J. Arcega-Whiteside
description: In 22 career games, the Eagles' second-round pick in 2019 has 12 total catches, or 11 fewer than Travis Fulgham in 5 games.
why: Arcega-Whiteside has had every opportunity to make his mark. The Eagles will be forever haunted for drafting him over D.K. Metcalf.

name: Derek Barnett
description: The Eagles' first-round pick in 2017 has played well when healthy, which hasn't been often enough.
why: Barnett is one of the young players that the Eagles want to build around. They need him to stay productive, and healthy.

name: Corey Clement
description: Clement will forever remembered for his rookie season, which he capped with 100 receiving yards in the Super Bowl.
why: Clement is good on special teams, but he is not the same runner that he was as a rookie. The Eagles have his replacement in James Huntley.

name: Fletcher Cox
description: Cox has been selected to the Pro Bowl in each of the last five seasons. But he has just 6 sacks since the start of the 2019 season.
why: But only if Cox restructures his contract because he will count $23.9 million against the salary cap next season.

name: Jake Elliott
description: Elliott has missed 4 field goals, although 3 of them were from 50 yards or more, and his success rate is just 66.7%
why: After signing a contract extension last winter, it's likely that the Eagles will bring in competition for him next summer.

name: Travis Fulgham
description: Where would the Eagles be without Fulgham, who was on the practice squad as recently as Oct. 3? His production in the first 5 games is second only to Terrell Owens in 2004.
why: Fulgham was cut three times this summer alone before getting his chance and shining. But he's a free agent after 2021.

name: Dallas Goedert
description: Both Goedert and Zach Ertz are eligible for free agency after 2021. They might have to trade one of them during the offseason.
why: Goedert is younger, a better blocker, and won't be as expensive as Ertz in his new contract.

name: Brandon Graham
description: At age 32 and in his 11th season, Graham is off to the best start of his career, with 7 sacks in 8 games.
why: Like Cox, Graham is expensive, costing $17 million against the cap next season. He, too, will have to restructure in order to stay.

name: Javon Hargrave
description: Hargrave, the Eagles' free agent signee last spring, hasn't yet peformed up to his $13 million annual average contract.
why: The Eagles strongly believe in supporting Fletcher Cox, and Hargrave is a key component in that.

name: Jalen Hurts
description: Hurts was the Eagles' second-round pick, an early slot for a backup quarterback with little chance of playing much.
why: Carson Wentz has had a poor season so far. The Eagles could move on as soon as 2022. But Hurts has only thrown 2 NFL passes.

name: Malik Jackson
description: Jackson played in just one game in 2019 after signing a big contract, and hasn't been as productive as expected.
why: The Eagles can't afford to pay Cox, Hargrave and Jackson next season. Jackson is the oldest and least productive of the three.

name: Alshon Jeffery
description: Jeffery has yet to play this season after having foot surgery last December. He suffered a calf injury while ramping up to return.
why: Jeffery would've been gone by now if the Eagles didn't have to eat $26 million in cap space. After this season, it'll be down to $10 million.

name: Lane Johnson
description: When healthy, Johnson is easily one of the top tight ends in the NFL. But he has played just 1 full game this season.
why: He is in the same category as Cox and Graham, older veteran with big salaries who'll have to restructure their contracts.

name: Cameron Johnston
description: Johnston is having a strong season, ranking among the top six among punters in net average and punts downed inside the 20.
why: Johnston continues to be a solid contributor. But it never hurts to bring in competition next summer.

name: Jason Kelce
description: Kelce is the only projected starting offensive lineman to play every game so far this season, and he's doing it at a high level, as usual
why: Kelce, who has considered retirement in each of the past few offseasons, is a vital cog in the offensive line.

name: Avonte Maddox
description: Maddox isn't nearly at the level of Slay. But he's young, and as long as Slay is productive, Maddox should have plenty of safety help.
why: Maddox is one of the young players who the Eagles want to develop. He'll never be a star, but he's good enough.

name: Jordan Mailata
description: Many thought Mailata wouldn't make the team this summer. Yet the Australian rugby star has started 4 games and held his own.
why: Mailata should have a role next season as a backup at left and right tackle.

name: Rodney McLeod
description: McLeod signed a 2-year deal last March, and has taken over the leadership void left by Malcolm Jenkins.
why: The Eagles would like to find a young replacement, but McLeod is valuable for another season.

name: Jalen Mills
description: Mills is in his first season at safety, with mixed results, after spending his first four seasons at cornerback.
why: Mills is eligible for free agency, and the Eagles have rookie K'Von Wallace and other role players to take over.

name: Will Parks
description: Parks missed the first five games with an injury, but has played well since returning. But he's eligible for free agency.
why: Again, the Eagles expect Wallace to start next to McLeod next season, and the Eagles also have Marcus Epps and Rudy Ford as backups.

name: Jason Peters
description: Peters is 38 years old and in his 17th season, and for the first time, he's playing like a fading veteran, especially at left tackle.
why: It's time to cut the cord. Peters will be in the Hall of Fame one day. But the Eagles need to get younger and cheaper.

name: Miles Sanders
description: Sanders is having a great season, when he has played, reeling off 2 runs of 74 yards. But he has missed 3 games with injuries.
why: The Eagles consider him their main running back, but they might have to sign a free agent in case he gets hurt again.

name: Boston Scott
description: Scott has value as a 3rd running back, as a receiver, and on special teams. But he's averaging just 3.8 yards per carry.
why: Scott can provide depth at RB, but not as a starter if Sanders gets hurt.

name: Darius Slay
description: Slay has shut down the opponent's top receiver in every game, enabling the Eagles' secondary to transform into one of the NFL's best.
why: Slay's 3-year, $50 million contract extension starts kicking in next season. At this point, he's worth it.

name: Nate Sudfeld
description: It seems like every season Sudfeld vies for the backup quarterback position, and every year he ends up as third string.
why: The Eagles have Jalen Hurts now, and someone will pay Sudfeld to serve as a backup.

name: Josh Sweat
description: Sweat has worked himself into a regular part of the defensive end rotation, giving the Eagles 3 solid DEs with him, Graham and Barnett.
why: Sweat will ultimately be Graham's replacement. He's young, cheap and the Eagles need him to keep developing.

name: Greg Ward
description: Ward, like Fulgham, is another former practice squad player who found a regular role. He leads the Eagles with 32 receptions.
why: As a slot receiver, Ward is reliable, ranking among the NFL's leaders in 3rd-down receptions.

name: Carson Wentz
description: Wentz is having the worst season of his career, leading the NFL with 16 turnovers. But he has also led 2 comeback wins this season.
why: Wentz is signed through 2024, but the Eagles can turn to Hurts as soon as the 2022 season if Wentz doesn't improve.

name: Andre Dillard
description: The Eagles' first-round pick in 2019, Dillard was expected to take over for Jason Peters until a biceps injury in August ended his season.
why: The Eagles desperately need Dillard to become a starting-caliber left tackle. He'll get every chance to do that in 2021.

name: Zach Ertz
description: Ertz set an NFL record for receptions in a season by a tight end. But he's having an awful season, and is frustrated by his contract.
why: Ertz is on IR, but Eagles can trade him during offseason because they can't afford both him and Goedert.

name: Nathan Gerry
description: Gerry has been burned often in pass coverage, but he still plays nearly every snap because Eagles have devalued the position.
why: The Eagles have T.J. Edwards and drafted 2 players. They should pursue an upgrade in free agency.

name: DeSean Jackson
description: Jackson, considered a top deep threat, has played in just 7 out of a possible 25 games, and he might not play again this season.
why: Jackson turns 34 in December, and the Eagles drafted 3 speed receivers, led by Jalen Reagor, who need to play.
